data.title: Cool décor and excellent staff – try a beer flight!
data.text:
We went to Torrent Brewing Company to grab a few pints.  The pub is industrial in design, with a pool table, board games, high ceilings and behind the bar are several chalkboards that describe how beer is made, the definitions of different beer terms, and a list of their on-tap beers along with their ABV and IBU numbers.
They have a lot of unique beer styles – including a milk stout and a double IPA (very high IBU).  I think trying the beer fight is likely the best way to get a well-rounded impression of their wares.  That being said, the bartenders were happy to provide small samples of any beer on tap as well.
If I lived in Ames, I think I would be a regular at this place!

data.title: Great place!
data.text: Great beer, awesome atmosphere, fun people! Good for families, couples or grabbing a pint by your lonesome. Highly recommended!

data.title: A work in progress -- let's call it 3 1/2 out of a possible 5.
data.text:
Torrent is a part-time brewpub. By that, I mean it's not open Mondays or Tuesdays and it doesn't open until 3:30 the rest of the week.
 The selection is small -- about  dozen types of beer in all -- but covers a nice range. I recommend trying a beer flight for a sampling. If you find a brew you really like, you can take home a growler.  (If you want a larger selection, then try Old Main, 2 blocks south.) I also recommend their home-brewed root beer.
What Torrents lacks in ambience -- hey, it's a converted truck garage -- it tries to make for in other interesting ways: 1) They welcome parties, meetings, and book clubs. 2) You can bring in your own food and treats.(All they other in the way of eats is popcorn and chips.)  3) They've begun to invite food trucks to park outside for those who want a meal with their brew.
The current schedule is Beastro (gourmet burgers and hot dogs) on Fridays and Rico's Tacos on Saturdays. If they add some more food trucks to the rotation, they could probably go full time. 
P.S. - Most of us locals agree that Rico's offers the best Mexican food in Ames. Try it for yourself and see. 
.

data.title: Work Chriatmas party
data.text:
Went for a work Christmas party. First off they were great to work with. Helpful and very tolerant to our needs. The space is open, inviting and they are just around the corner from the Main street with other stuff to do. Ames has three Breweries I think and as for actual beer quality I peg them as #2. In the category of selection they probably have the other two beat. They had a cider, I think a raspberry blonde, an NA root beer that was good not to mention about 8 more traditional Kraft options (ipa,stout, etc...
They are a pretty new business so I expect some of the tastes to evolve a bit. I would say its a great spot to hit if your in town. A flight of four 3 ouncers is always fun

data.title: Nice tap room. Great place to watch a game. Beer just ok.
data.text: Torrent is located in an old warehouse renovated into a nice looking tap room. Lots of TVs, including a really big one (maybe 80 inches). We stopped in to watch an ISU game and it was great for that. There's also a pool table and foosball table. The beer was a bit disappointing--I would describe as just ok. Tried 3 Amarillo Pale Ale, American Brown, and Raspberry Blonde. Nothing great. Just ok.

data.title: good beer stop
data.text: downtown in a ware house, fun atmosphere.  Several kinds of beer on tap.  We had a flight and the beer was okay, we visit lots of breweries and feel we know great beer.  This was okay beer, we would try them again to see what they have new.

data.title: Good Beer.
data.text: I loved the hefe wheat.  Blonde.  Brown.  Pale ale.  All great!!!  Nice atmosphere.  We will be back here for sure.

data.title: On business at the University of Iowa
data.text: Excellent microbrewery and friendly atmosphere.  Bar hops are a little more tatted than I prefer but I suppose that just adds to the overall ambience.

data.title: Great Beers - Open Space
data.text:
My husband and I stopped by Torrent Brewing Company this weekend.  The space is an old car dealership and they've left a lot of the original fixtures.  The brewery is very industrial in decor and very open with lots of big windows and plenty of parking.  They have a pool table, a foosball table, and a couple of TVs.  They also have a party room for rent, which would be a nice place.

My husband and I split a flight of their own brews and were pleased with all of them.  I was driving, so I had some of their root beer which is made in house.  It was delicious and inexpensive, which was a nice benefit.

The bar tender was friendly and explained a lot about the brewery.  She informed us that they are planning on having an outdoors beer garden when the weather warms and that they have a BBQ food truck that comes in on Friday nights.

Overall I enjoyed the experience and would be back again if in Ames!
